business.headline: Reliance Group clarifies: ED-attached assets belong to Rcom, business unaffectedReliance Group said that the action has no impact on the business operations of Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power.

Is India's tax system fueling the IPO rush? Zerodha's Nithin Kamath thinks soIndia's booming startup economy may be running on a system that rewards valuation over value, and growth over resilience, says Nithin Kamath.

Hinduja Group Chairman Gopichand P Hinduja dies at London hospitalGopichand P Hinduja, who represented the second generation of the influential business family, took charge of the multinational Hinduja Group in May 2023, following the death of his elder brother, Srichand P Hinduja.
Sensex ends 519 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 519.34 points to close at 83,459.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 165.70 points to end at 25,597.65.

Bajaj Finance festive loan volume rises 27% as more first-time borrowers opt for creditThe company added 23 lakh new customers during this period, with 52% of them new to credit. This signals that access to formal borrowing is widening beyond traditional urban consumers.

Caveat filed, battle begins: What's next for Mehli Mistry and Tata TrustsMistry's three-year term as trustee ended on October 28, 2025. A circular was issued on 23 October seeking approval for his reappointment as a life trustee.

Is your money in good shape? 5 financial vitals to check every yearWhen was the last time you checked the health of your finances? Are your savings, investments, and expenses aligned with your goals, or drifting off track? A quick yearly check-up can reveal the answers.

UP government announces 1% recovery relief for rice millers and farmers. Details hereNearly two lakh employment opportunities are expected to get a boost as rice mills expand their operations. It will also increase competition among millers, making procurement faster and more efficient.

Race for the rare earths: Why India is tripling its magnet betIndia's clean-tech future depends on independence in the smallest technologies. Owning magnet manufacturing protects growth, shields jobs, and ensures ambitions are never paused by politics outside the country's borders.

From 20 years to 11: Expert shares how smart home loan hacks can save Rs 30 lakhTurning a 20-year home loan into an 11-year success story may sound ambitious, but with the right strategy, it's entirely possible. A few simple tweaks, like extra EMIs and gradual step-ups, can help borrowers save up to Rs 30 lakh in interest, says an expert.

Is Europe on your bucket list? Here's why now is the best time to visitAccording to the report, the average travel packages across major European destinations are 25–40% cheaper in the winter months compared to the busy June–August period.

EPFO partners with IPPB to offer doorstep Digital Life Certificate serviceThe Doorstep Digital Life Certificate service is based on Jeevan Pramaan, a digital certificate that confirms a pensioner's life status using Aadhaar-based biometric verification.

India's top 1% grew wealth by 62% since 2000, finds G20-backed reportThe study warns that inequality worldwide has now reached levels that threaten democratic stability, economic resilience and climate cooperation.

Airtel shares rise 3% after Q2 results. Should you buy or sell?For the second quarter of FY26, Bharti Airtel reported a 73.6% year-on-year increase in consolidated net profit to Rs 6,792 crore, supported by solid growth in both its India and Africa operations.

Does bitcoin hedge against inflation the way gold does?For centuries, gold has been that safe haven, protecting wealth against inflation and systemic shocks. Lately, Bitcoin has joined that category, emerging as an alternative for investors looking to hedge against uncertainty in an increasingly digital world.

NSE to launch pre-open session for F&O segment. Key details traders should knowThe pre-open will run for 15 minutes, from 9:00 am to 9:15 am. The first part of this window is where traders can place, modify, or cancel orders. That phase will close at a random moment between 9:07 and 9:08 am, preventing last-second order manipulation.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as markets consolidate before key Q2 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 123.01 points to 83,855.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 53.50 points to 25,710.05 as of 9:33 am.

Amazon, OpenAI sign massive $38 billion deal for Nvidia chipsUnder the deal, AWS will provide OpenAI with access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia graphics processing units (GPUs), including the latest GB200 and GB300 AI accelerators.

Groww IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPThe Rs 6,632.30 crore Groww IPO opens for bidding on November 4 and will close on November 7, 2025. The issue includes a fresh issue worth Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of Rs 5,572.30 crore.

ED has attached assets under PMLA, Anil Ambani not on board: Reliance InfraThe clarification follows the ED's latest attachment of over 132 acres of land at Dhirubhai Ambani Knowledge City in Navi Mumbai, worth Rs 4,462 crore, in a bank fraud case involving Reliance Communications and related firms.

entertainment.headline: Khushi Kapoor-Karishma Tanna to take Sridevi's legacy ahead with Mom 2: Report Actors Khushi Kapoor and Karishma Tanna are reportedly slated to star in the sequel to the National Award-winning film 'Mom'. Released in 2017, the film was Sridevi's last film.

SRK replies to birthday wishes from Akshay, Kajol and others with his signature wit Shah Rukh Khan, who turned 60 on November 2, has now responded to heartfelt wishes from his industry friends with his trademark wit and warmth. From joking with Akshay Kumar to sharing nostalgic notes with Kajol and Anupam Kher, the superstar's replies have once again won hearts.

Delhi Crime 3: Huma Qureshi calls it the best worst role of her career Actor Huma Qureshi revealed details about her challenging role in 'Delhi Crime Season 3', describing it as the most unsettling character she has portrayed so far. The trailer for the new season was launched in Mumbai, with Qureshi sharing her excitement and apprehension about joining the acclaimed Netflix crime series.

Ramya Krishnan steals spotlight with bold avatar in Police Station Mein Bhoot Director Ram Gopal Varma's return to the horror genre has been anticipated ever since the announcement of his next film, 'Police Station Mein Bhoot'. With this latest update, the buzz surrounding the film has only grown stronger.

SS Rajamouli's next with Mahesh Babu reportedly titled Varanasi: Reports According to a news report, a source close to the project revealed that the yet-to-be-titled film directed by SS Rajamouli is titled 'Varanasi'. The film stars Mahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra in the lead.

Ritwik Ghatak: The master who turned strife, separation and suffering into art While the world struggles with exile, fracture, pain, and injustice, legendary filmmaker Ritwik Ghatak's vision and outrage remain alive. Ghatak turned wounds into art. On his 100th birthday, the star shines on in every filmmaker he inspired.

Proud Amitabh Bachchan cheers for grandson Agastya after watching Ikkis trailer Amitabh Bachchan cheered for his grandson Agastya Nanda ahead of 'Ikkis', where Agastya plays Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal. Directed by Sriram Raghavan, the film releases in theatres on December 25.

Child artiste slams Prakash Raj, Kerala State Film Awards for ignoring children The Kerala State Film Awards 2025 have sparked controversy after the Prakash Raj-led jury withheld honours for Best Children's Film and Best Child Artist, prompting backlash from young actors and filmmakers.

Siddhu Jonnalagadda: I'm an easy target because I am an outsider | Exclusive Siddhu Jonnalagadda opens up about breaking free from his DJ Tillu image and the challenges of Telugu cinema. He shares insights on balancing creative expression with commercial success while navigating outsider vulnerabilities.

Sonakshi Sinha on trusting her instincts while choosing Lootera despite warnings Sonakshi Sinha shared that despite being advised against doing 'Lootera' early in her career, she followed her instinct and took on the role that remains one of her most cherished. The actress, now promoting 'Jatadhara', said she still receives immense love for her portrayal of Paakhi even after 12 years.

Aamir Khan credits his mother for casting Sakshi Tanwar in Dangal Aamir Khan shared that it was his mother who inspired him to cast Sakshi Tanwar in 'Dangal', after admiring her performances on television. The actor praised Sakshi's talent and sincerity, while she called being part of the blockbuster film a stroke of destiny.

Delhi Crime 3 trailer: Shefali Shah hunts for ruthless human trafficking queenpin Netflix unveiled the trailer for 'Delhi Crime Season 3', starring Shefali Shah as DCP Vartika Chaturvedi, who returns to uncover a chilling human trafficking nexus. The new season pits her against a ruthless queenpin, played by Huma Qureshi.

Thamma director says Shraddha Kapoor was in talks to play lesbian Bittu in Munjya Director Aditya Sarpotdar stated that he changed the original storyline of 'Munjya' by removing a lesbian character to be played by Shraddha Kapoor. The new narrative explored contrasting emotional journeys of male and female characters in love, adding depth and drama.

British Independent Film Awards 2025 nominations: My Father's Shadow, Pillion lead Akinola Davies Jr.'s debut and Harry Lighton's latest film lead this year's BIFA nominations, joined by standout performances from global talents and acclaimed stars.

Prabhas The Raja Saab on track for January release, makers dismiss delay news The makers of Prabhas's upcoming film 'The Raja Saab' have dismissed rumours of a release delay, confirming its worldwide theatrical debut on January 9, 2026. Producer TG Vishwa Prasad released an official note regarding the same.

Exclusive: Nawazuddin Siddiqui calls I Am Not An Actor his most unique film yet Nawazuddin Siddiqui stars as a retired banker dealing with depression in 'I Am Not An Actor'. Ahead of the film's release in the UK, the actor spoke about the film's unique shooting style and his character in depth.

You fought for us, bhai: Celina Jaitly finds hope as court aids brother in UAE The Delhi High Court directed the Centre to ensure legal aid for Major (retd.) Vikrant Kumar Jaitly, brother of actor Celina Jaitly, detained in the UAE for over a year. Celina calls the court's move a "ray of hope" after months of silence.

Exclusive: Bigg Boss 19 producer reveals mental health measures to protect contestants ''Bigg Boss 19' makers have introduced strict mental health protocols for contestants. This move aims to safeguard participants amid the show's intense environment, reveals the show's producer, Rishi Negi.

SRK confirms romantic angle with Deepika Padukone in Siddharth Anand's King Shah Rukh Khan unveiled the first look of his film 'King' on his 60th birthday. The actor also revealed about a romantic angle with Deepika Padukone in the movie.

general news.headline: 10% of population controls Army: Rahul Gandhi's remark in Bihar sparks rowRahul Gandhi said in Bihar's Kutumba that only 10% of the country's population, the upper castes, control the Army and major institutions, while 90% of Dalits, backward and minority communities remain unrepresented.

5 killed as passenger train rams goods train in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur, rescue onChhattisgarh train accident: The crash derailed several coaches and damaged overhead wires and signalling systems, disrupting rail traffic on the Bilaspur–Katni section. Rescue and relief operations are underway, with several trains cancelled or diverted.

Joining US army best shot at citizenship? Indian Green Card soldier explainsWhile there's a growing anti-immigrant sentiment in the US, thousands of immigrants, including Indians, are serving in the US military. Many join the wings of the American military for stable pay, benefits, and a faster path to citizenship. The reason why America allows foreigners to be enlisted into its forces is its recruitment shortfalls.

I killed my wife for you: Bengaluru doctor's message to women weeks after murderAfter killing his dermatologist wife with an anaesthetic drug, Bengaluru doctor Mahendra Reddy sent a chilling message, "I killed my wife for you", to several women, including one who had earlier rejected him.

How Kashmir's own IPL featuring stars like Chris Gayle ended in chaosThe much-touted Indian Heaven Premier League was believed to be Kashmir's own IPL. It had all the trappings, from international stars like Chris Gayle to Jesse Ryder participating in it. However, organisers fled midway, leaving behind unpaid bills and a massive political fiasco.

Delhi sixth most polluted city in India in October. This city ranks firstWhile stubble burning accounted for less than 6 per cent of Delhi's particulate matter in October, the surge in pollution levels pointed to year-round emission sources.

Did Pakistan test nuclear weapons recently?Donald Trump's recent statement about Pakistan testing nuclear weapons fuels social media speculation about a string of earthquakes between April and May 2025.

Video: Andhra teacher gets foot massage from students in class, suspendedA teacher at a government-run tribal school in Andhra Pradesh was suspended after a viral video showed her having her feet massaged by students. Officials have ordered a fresh inquiry into the incident.

The ultimate sacrifice: When a dog went to space to never returnA gentle, mixed-breed dog weighing just 6 kilograms, Laika was chosen for her calm temperament and small size, making her ideal for the tight confines of the Sputnik 2 capsule.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Why Rahul Gandhi's fishing photo-op may not reel in Bihar votersDays before the first phase of Bihar elections, Rahul Gandhi's fishing outing has reeled in a political storm — with allies, rivals, and even insiders debating whether the Congress leader is casting his net in the right waters.

Ashwin praises Harmanpreet-led India for honouring legends: Men's team never did itRavichandran Ashwin's bold words hit home after India's historic win. The off-spinner praised Harmanpreet Kaur's side for doing what, in his view, the men's team never did, sharing their glory with past legends.

US courts halt deportation of Indian-origin man wrongfully jailed for 43 yearsSubramanyam 'Subu' Vedam, who came to the US when he was 9 months old, was arrested in 1982 for allegedly killing his friend. He spent more than 40 years in prison before his conviction was overturned.

Live: Voting to elect next New York mayor officially beginsNew York City heads to the polls on Tuesday in a fiercely contested three-way mayoral race that has captured national attention, pitting progressive Democrat Zohran Mamdani against independent Andrew Cuomo and Republican Curtis Sliwa. With President Donald Trump's second-term policies looming large over the campaign, the election marks the first major political test of the post-Trump resurgence era. Mamdani, the Democratic Socialist frontrunner, has dominated polls and drawn sharp criticism from the president himself as voters prepare to decide who will lead America's largest city.

More clout for Pak army chief Asim Munir? Buzz over Constitution amendment bidPakistan has decided to push through a controversial constitutional amendment widely seen as designed to secure the position and power of army chief Asim Munir.

Please help me! Suryakumar Yadav makes plea to AB de Villiers to save ODI careerSuryakumar Yadav has asked AB de Villiers to help him revive his ODI career as the 35-year-old is eyeing a comeback into the side. Suryakumar is currently a T20I specialist for India and leads the side in the format.

From village roots to the Supreme Court, the journey of Chief Justice Surya KantJustice Surya Kant's journey from a small Haryana village to the Chief Justice of India is a story of steady grit, scholarship, and public service. Rooted in humble beginnings, India's new CJI rose through courts with landmark judgments, a reform-minded approach, and a reputation for fairness as he takes charge of India's judiciary.

Ritwik Ghatak: The master who turned strife, separation and suffering into artWhile the world struggles with exile, fracture, pain, and injustice, legendary filmmaker Ritwik Ghatak's vision and outrage remain alive. Ghatak turned wounds into art. On his 100th birthday, the star shines on in every filmmaker he inspired.

SRK replies to birthday wishes from Akshay, Kajol and others with his signature witShah Rukh Khan, who turned 60 on November 2, has now responded to heartfelt wishes from his industry friends with his trademark wit and warmth. From joking with Akshay Kumar to sharing nostalgic notes with Kajol and Anupam Kher, the superstar's replies have once again won hearts.

Tharoor should blame Kamaraj also for dynastic politics, not just NehruCongress leader Shashi Tharoor critiques the Nehru-Gandhi family's role in cementing dynastic politics in India. Historically, it was party kingmaker Kamaraj who helped Indira Gandhi become PM after Shastri's death.

Popcorn brain is stealing your focus. Here's what you can doPopcorn brain describes the wired, restless state caused by non-stop screen exposure. Here's how overstimulation drains focus, affects emotion, and why teens are especially vulnerable, plus tips on how to reset.

Bihar bizarre: Tejashwi, not Nitish, fights anti-incumbency, candidate is keyThough Nitish Kumar has ruled Bihar for most of the last 20 years, it seems it is Mahagathbandhan's CM candidate, Tejashwi Yadav, who is actually fighting anti-incumbency from Lalu's era. Though Modi magic is intact, in this neck-on-neck fight, it will ultimately boil down to candidate selection. But whoever wins, will Bihar really win?

Actor Celina Jaitly's brother detained in UAE, court asks Centre to step inIn a big relief for actor Celina Jaitly, the Delhi High Court directed the Ministry of External Affairs to provide legal assistance for her brother, Major Vikrant Kumar Jaitly, who has been detained in the UAE for over a year.

Harmanpreet Kaur's wax statue to be unveiled in Jaipur to celebrate World Cup winJaipur Wax Museum will unveil a wax statue of Harmanpreet Kaur on International Women's Day 2026. The statue celebrates India's historic Women's World Cup win and women's empowerment in sports.

sports.headline: Amanjot Kaur quashes rumours of grandmother's death: My 90s kid doing absolutely fine India all-rounder Amanjot Kaur dismissed rumours about her grandmother's death, confirming that she is in good health and urging people not to spread misinformation. Amanjot, who played a key role in India's World Cup triumph, took a stunning catch to dismiss Laura Wolvaardt in the final against South Africa.

Sean Williams reveals battle with drug addiction, Zimbabwe career ends abruptly Zimbabwe cricket has announced that former captain Sean Williams is battling drug addiction and won't be considered for national team selection anymore. Williams' current contract won't be extended after its expiry on December 31 this year.

Please help me! Suryakumar Yadav makes plea to AB de Villiers to save ODI career Suryakumar Yadav has asked AB de Villiers to help him revive his ODI career as the 35-year-old is eyeing a comeback into the side. Suryakumar is currently a T20I specialist for India and leads the side in the format.

Serbian league football coach dies after collapsing midway through a match Serbian football coach Mladen Zizovic has died at age 44 after collapsing during a Super Liga match. The game was abandoned as players and staff were left in shock. Zizovic had taken charge of FK Radnicki 1923 less than two weeks before his passing.

Harmanpreet Kaur's wax statue to be unveiled in Jaipur to celebrate World Cup win Jaipur Wax Museum will unveil a wax statue of Harmanpreet Kaur on International Women's Day 2026. The statue celebrates India's historic Women's World Cup win and women's empowerment in sports.

WPL 2026 auction to take place in New Delhi on November 27: Reports The Women's Premier League (WPL) 2026 auction will be held on November 27 in Aerocity, with franchises finalising retentions by November 5 and the player pool revealed on November 7.

How Kashmir's own IPL featuring stars like Chris Gayle ended in chaos The much-touted Indian Heaven Premier League was believed to be Kashmir's own IPL. It had all the trappings, from international stars like Chris Gayle to Jesse Ryder participating in it. However, organisers fled midway, leaving behind unpaid bills and a massive political fiasco.

Abhishek Sharma is a serious talent, hopefully we get him out cheaply: Kuhnemann Australia spinner Matt Kuhnemann praised India opener Abhishek Sharma ahead of the fourth T20I, calling him a serious batting talent who can take the game away early. Kuhnemann hopes the Australian pacers can remove him in the powerplay to contain India's explosive start.

Yashasvi Jaiswal hits century for Mumbai at IPL home, reaches Ranji landmark Yashasvi Jaiswal marked his first Ranji Trophy appearance since January 2025 with a century for Mumbai against Rajasthan at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium. The innings reinforced his status as a key performer in domestic and international cricket.

Laura Wolvaardt's brother ecstatic with bragging rights for Women's World Cup hero Laura Wolvaardt's brother, Luca, was delighted after his sister finished the Women's World Cup as the leading run-scorer. Wolvaardt also became the No.1 batter in the ODI rankings, displacing India's Smriti Mandhana.

Xabi Alonso says Florian Wirtz is a reason behind him getting Real Madrid job Real Madrid head coach Xabi Alonso acknowledged Florian Wirtz's key influence on his managerial journey before Madrid's Champions League clash with Liverpool. Alonso reflected on the pair's success at Bayer Leverkusen and addressed recent squad developments, including Vinicius Jr.'s El Clásico reaction.

The innings reinforced his status as a key performer in domestic and international cricket.

Wolvaardt also became the No.1 batter in the ODI rankings, displacing India's Smriti Mandhana.

Xabi Alonso says Florian Wirtz is a reason behind him getting Real Madrid job Real Madrid head coach Xabi Alonso acknowledged Florian Wirtz's key influence on his managerial journey before Madrid's Champions League clash with Liverpool. Alonso reflected on the pair's success at Bayer Leverkusen and addressed recent squad developments, including Vinicius Jr.'s El Clásico reaction.

Why Pratika Rawal didn't get the Women's World Cup winner's medal: ExplainedWomen's World Cup: Pratika Rawal scored 308 runs in seven matches, including a top score of 122 against New Zealand, but did not receive a winner's medal after India clinched the title. Here's why.

Mirabai Chanu's move to 53 kg for Olympics seen as positive step, says national coachMirabai Chanu will move up to the 53kg weight class for the 2028 Olympics after the 49kg division was removed. Her coach believes the shift will reduce the strain of weight cuts and help her build greater strength ahead of the LA Games.

Women's World Cup triumph shows WPL and pay parity worked: Rohan JaitleyFollowing India's Women's World Cup 2025 triumph, DDCA President Rohan Jaitley spoke to IndiaToday.in about how the victory will benefit the women's game. He also outlined the efforts being made at the grassroots level to help budding female cricketers realise their dreams.

Real Madrid boss Xabi Alonso urges Trent Alexander-Arnold to enjoy Anfield returnTrent Alexander-Arnold is set for an emotional Anfield homecoming as Real Madrid face Liverpool in the Champions League, with manager Xabi Alonso urging his former club's star to simply enjoy the moment.

RCB appoint ex-India tormenter as WPL bowling coach, Luke Williams resigns: ReportsFormer England pacer Anya Shrubsole has been named the new bowling coach of Royal Challengers Bengaluru ahead of WPL 2026. Meanwhile, Malolan Rangarajan is set to take over as head coach after Luke Williams stepped down.

Dewald Brevis ruled out of Pakistan ODI series, to undergo rehab for India tourDewald Brevis has been ruled out of South Africa's ODI series against Pakistan after sustaining a shoulder strain in the final T20I. He will undergo rehab with the Proteas medical team to prepare for the upcoming Test tour of India.

Real Madrid boss Xabi Alonso urges Trent Alexander-Arnold to enjoy Anfield returnTrent Alexander-Arnold is set for an emotional Anfield homecoming as Real Madrid face Liverpool in the Champions League, with manager Xabi Alonso urging his former club's star to simply enjoy the moment.

RCB appoint ex-India tormenter as WPL bowling coach, Luke Williams resigns: ReportsFormer England pacer Anya Shrubsole has been named the new bowling coach of Royal Challengers Bengaluru ahead of WPL 2026. Meanwhile, Malolan Rangarajan is set to take over as head coach after Luke Williams stepped down.

Dewald Brevis ruled out of Pakistan ODI series, to undergo rehab for India tourDewald Brevis has been ruled out of South Africa's ODI series against Pakistan after sustaining a shoulder strain in the final T20I. He will undergo rehab with the Proteas medical team to prepare for the upcoming Test tour of India.

Smriti Mandhana dethroned, Laura Wolvaardt takes top spot in Women's ODI rankingsLaura Wolvaardt's record World Cup run has pushed her past Smriti Mandhana to become the No.1 ODI batter. India still saw key gains, with Jemimah Rodrigues entering the top ten and Deepti Sharma rising to fourth among all-rounders.

We followed spirit of the game: Hockey India to continue handshakes with PakistanHockey India has clarified that it will not stop players from shaking hands with Pakistan in future matches, stating that its approach follows the Olympic Charter and FIH guidelines. HI emphasized maintaining sportsmanship and focusing on performance.

R Ashwin to miss Big Bash League, reveals injury during training in ChennaiBBL 15: R Ashwin, who was set to become the first male cricketer from India to play in the Big Bash League, has withdrawn from the upcoming season due to a knee injury. Ashwin signed to play for the Sydney Thunder.

A cut bat from her father sparked Harmanpreet Kaur's dream to play for IndiaWomen's World Cup 2025: Speaking after India's World Cup triumph, Harmanpreet Kaur reminisced about how she began dreaming of playing cricket for the country as a child. The 36-year-old said her father was the one who gave wings to her dreams.

Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues ready to jam with Sunil Gavaskar after World Cup promiseWomen's World Cup: Jemimah Rodrigues is ready to make Sunil Gavaskar's fun World Cup promise come true. The Indian star called out the legend after India's historic title win, saying she's ready for their long-awaited musical jam.

Rahul Dravid's son Anvay named in U19 One-Day Challenger Trophy squadRahul Dravid's son Anvay has been named in one of the four squads for the men's Under-19 One-Day Challenger Trophy. The tournament will be played in Hyderabad from November 5 to 11.

Jonathan Trott to step away as Afghanistan head coach after 2026 T20 World CupJonathan Trott will step down as Afghanistan's head coach after the 2026 T20 World Cup, ending a remarkable stint that saw historic wins and steady growth. The ACB calls it a planned transition for long-term progress.

After Kane Williamson, Lucknow Super Giants add Tom Moody to managementFormer Australian cricketer Tom Moody takes charge as Global Director of Cricket for Lucknow Super Giants, assuming responsibility for multiple franchises. His appointment arrives weeks before the IPL 2026 auction. Earlier in October, Lucknow roped in Kane Williamson as their strategic advisor.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
